snippet: Former Gov. John G. Rowland still has his portrait in the state’s gallery of former governors, and his name on several centers.
abstract: Former Connecticut Gov John G Rowland still has his portrait in gallery of former governors at Museum of Connecticut History and his name on several public institutions, despite fact that he is facing return to prison after being convicted in a campaign finance case; Rowland resigned a decade ago in disgrace midway through his third term and accepted a plea that sent him to prison for 10 months.
lead_paragraph: Former Gov. John G. Rowland still has his portrait in the state’s gallery of former governors, and his name on several centers.

headline.main: Rowland Name Endures on Connecticut Public Buildings, Despite Convictions
headline.print_headline: A Tarnished Name Endures on Connecticut Buildings
